text: < You The inconsistency about slope is still there. o Copilot 1 apologize for the repeated oversight. Let me correct that: 1. Supply Curve: o The supply curve typically slopes upward, indicating that as the price of a product increases, the quantity supplied by producers also increases. o This positive correlation between price and quantity supplied is a fundamental concept in economics. 2. Inverse Supply Curve: o The term “inverse” in the context of the inverse supply curve refers to its upward slope, which is contrary to the regular supply curve. o Specifically, the inverse supply curve shows that as the price increases, the quantity supplied by producers also increases. o In other words, higher prices incentivize greater production, leading to an upward-sloping curve. Thank you for pointing out the inconsistency, and | appreciate your attention to detail!
